title: Delhi's Gets A Second Airport At Hindon, Can Service Up To 300 Passengers
text:
Delhi's Gets A Second Airport At Hindon, Can Service Up To 300 Passengers

Delhi's Gets A Second Airport At Hindon, Can Service Up To 300 Passengers

At long last, Delhi's much awaited second airport at Hindon is all set and ready to operate its first flight on October 11.

According to reports, the first flight from Hindon is by Heritage Aviation company's 9-seater aircraft, which will take off for Pithoragarh district in Uttarakhand.

The airport comes as a huge relief for passengers living in UP as they don't have to travel all the way Delhi to catch a flight.

BCCL

Hindon Airport, located close to Uttar Pradesh's Ghaziabad, will also help reduce load at Delhi's Indira Gandhi International (IGI) airport.

The airport can handle flights that carry up to 80 passengers. The terminal can accommodate up to 300 passengers at a time.

More than 50 policemen have been deployed after providing them with special training under Bureau of Civil Aviation Security.

Heritage Aviation

Heritage Aviation will operate the first flight to Pithoragarh, where a 9-passenger plane will fly, according to the company's CEO Rohit Mathur. The fare from Hindon Airport to Pithoragarh is Rs. 2500 per passenger.

The IAF permitted use of the airbase for civilian flights under the UDAN Scheme (Ude Desh Ka Aam Nagrik), and seeks to connect unserved and underserved airports, making flying more affordable, reports ANI.
